page.title: 05HOUSING continued
page.content: ARCHITECTURAL SURVEY:Shootersway: The houses in this area all date from after the end of the Second World War and give an impression of wealth.They can be split into two main categories:bungalows and American-style country houses. The bungalows tended to be made of painted stone,fairly big and in large plots of land,with spacious gardens. The country houses were extremely large with even larger gardens than the bungalows.One was very typical of a country house in Alabama,with columns and porticos. Most of both sorts of houses had double garages,with drives through gates leading off a private road.
